intro: Sedum wannanense, commonly known as the Wannan stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to China. It belongs to the Crassulaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, upright stems and clusters of small, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy habitats and is adapted to arid environments. Its leaves are usually blue-gray in color, and it blooms in shades of pink or white. Sedum wannanense is valued for its ornamental appeal and drought tolerance in landscaping.
